metadata.Title: CVE-2020-5209 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.Description:
In NetHack before 3.6.5, unknown options starting with -de and -i can cause a buffer overflow resulting in a crash or remote code execution/privilege escalation. This vulnerability affects systems that have NetHack installed suid/sgid and shared systems that allow users to influence command line options. Users should upgrade to NetHack 3.6.5.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-5209` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

nethack-common - 3.6.6-1
nethack-console - 3.6.6-1
nethack-qt - 3.6.6-1
nethack-x11 - 3.6.6-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: msalvatore> Nethack is installed sgid games, but not suid or sgid root.

criterions.comment: nethack package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.6.6-1').
